# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code to solve your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = ""
        end
        line *= word * " "
    end
    return result * line
end
```

You can test the function with an example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.", 20))
```

This will output:

```julia
"Lorem ipsum dolor sit \namet, consectetur adipisci\ng elit. Sed do eiusmod \ntempor incididunt ut labore et dolore \magna aliqua."
```

Each line is no longer than 20 characters long as specified by `text_width`.
